<syn:updateFrequency>1</syn:updateFrequency>             <syn:updateBase>2010-09-11T14:21:18Z</syn:updateBase>             <image rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/logo.png"/>    <items>                    <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/brc"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/british-atmospheric-data-centre"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ca-lcc-ecn"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/chinese-ecosystem-research-network-cern"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/climatic-research-unit"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-information-system"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-survey"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecns-research-partners"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecn-sponsors"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust"/>            </rdf:Seq>   </items>  </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/alter-net">     <title>ALTER-Net</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/alter-net</link>     <description>ALTER-Net is a European network of mainly research organisations which aims to integrate biodiversity research capacity across Europe.  ALTER-Net began as a "Network of Excellence" funded by the EU's 6th Framework Programme, and is now self-financed by its member organisations.  </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:ecn-associated</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T14:25:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/arctic-monitoring-and-assessment-programme-amap">     <title>Arctic Monitoring and Assessment Programme (AMAP)</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/arctic-monitoring-and-assessment-programme-amap</link>     <description>AMAP is an international organization established in 1991 to implement components of the Arctic Environmental Protection Strategy (AEPS). AMAP's current objective is "providing reliable and sufficient information on the status of, and threats to, the Arctic environment, and providing scientific advice on actions to be taken in order to support Arctic governments in their efforts to take remedial and preventive actions relating to contaminants".</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-monitoring</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T14:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bicco-net">     <title>BICCO-Net</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bicco-net</link>     <description>BICCO-Net is a collaborative project providing the latest information on the impacts of Climate Change on UK biodiversity. ECN has provided data and expertise</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>climate change</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>biodiversity</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:ecn-associated</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2014-07-28T09:36:52Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/brc">     <title>Biological Records Centre</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/brc</link>     <description>The Biological Records Centre (BRC), established in 1964, is a national focus in the UK for terrestrial and freshwater species recording. The work of BRC is a major component of the National Biodiversity Network (NBN).</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-data</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-08-29T14:59:53Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves">     <title>Biosphere Reserves</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves</link>     <description>Biosphere reserves are sites established by countries and recognized under UNESCO's Man and the Biosphere (MAB) Programme to promote sustainable development based on local community efforts and sound science.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:25:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/british-atmospheric-data-centre">     <title>British Atmospheric Data Centre</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/british-atmospheric-data-centre</link>     <description>The role of the BADC is to assist UK atmospheric researchers to locate, access and interpret atmospheric data and to ensure the long-term integrity of atmospheric data produced by NERC projects. The BADC has substantial data holdings of its own and also provides information and links to data held by other data centres.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-data</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes">     <title>British Ecological Society</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes</link>     <description>The BES  was established in 1913 and has approximately 4,000 members worldwide. Its activities include publishing a range of scientific literature, organising and sponsoring meetings, funding grant schemes, education and policy work.  It also runs supporting initiatives such as the gratis book scheme which aims to make ecology publications available to those who couldn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt otherwise obtain them.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-08-29T14:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ca-lcc-ecn">     <title>California Landscape Conservation Cooperative ECN</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ca-lcc-ecn</link>     <description>An emerging network of environmental monitoring stations within the boundaries of the Californian Landscape Conservation Cooperative. The network has used UK ECN as its model.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-monitoring</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-11-09T12:10:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/chinese-ecosystem-research-network-cern">     <title>Chinese Ecosystem Research Network (CERN)</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/chinese-ecosystem-research-network-cern</link>     <description>CERN is an ecosystem research network with field stations throughout China covering the fields of  agriculture, forest, grassland, lake and marine ecosystems. </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-monitoring</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T14:00:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/climatic-research-unit">     <title>Climatic Research Unit</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/climatic-research-unit</link>     <description>The Climatic Research Unit is concerned with the study of natural and anthropogenic climate change. It has developed a number of the datasets including the global temperature record used to monitor the state of the climate system, as well as statistical software packages and climate models.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-data</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-information-system">     <title>Countryside Information System</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-information-system</link>     <description>The Countryside Information System (CIS) is a Microsoft Windows-based program developed to give policy advisers, planners and researchers easy access to spatial information about the British countryside.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-data</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-survey">     <title>Countryside Survey</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/countryside-survey</link>     <description>Countryside Survey is a unique study or \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdaudit\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd of the natural resources of the UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds countryside.  It has been carried out at regular intervals since 1978, allowing scientists to detect the gradual and subtle changes that occur in the UK\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds countryside over time.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:ecn-associated</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T14:30:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecns-research-partners">     <title>ECN's research partners</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecns-research-partners</link>     <description>ECN monitoring is supported by a range of research partners</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:ecn-associated</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:05:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecn-sponsors">     <title>ECN's sponsors</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecn-sponsors</link>     <description>ECN monitoring is carried out by a range of sponsoring organisations.  Each provides one or more sites and covers the costs of ECN measurements at those sites.  </description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:ecn-associated</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:05:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust">     <title>Ecological Continuity Trust</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust</link>     <description>The aim of the Ecological Continuity Trust is to initiate and maintain long-term experiments that are specifically designed to help future generations understand and manage ecological change.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:10:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>      </rdf:RDF>
